Understanding the Worldly Point of View.--An enlightened judgment compels us to acknowledge that heavenly things are superior to the things of earth, and yet the depraved heart of man leads him to give precedence 

774 

to the things of the world. The opinions of great men, the theories of science, falsely so called, are blended with the truths of Holy Writ.--RH, Nov 24, 1891.
